rpdO3yBcpH-FGz30ndYK8g.text: Cracking food, great surroundings, crap service. This place is a bit desperately trendy, but has an interesting mixed crowd at lunchtime. It's owned by the same people who run Room in Leeds (which is somewhere I used to frequent!), and you can tell. My fellow diners were happy enough with their food, and my lamb shank was delicious (see photos), but the fact that it took an hour to arrive means, only 3 stars from Phil. Sorry guys.

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom

sreT8RgoKS-dL6Gd-3QMWA.text: A bastion of glass and brass in Shoreditch. Simple, yet complete menu, heavy on the meat. Quality ingredients served correctly, with thought, and in ample quantity. Attentive service and open kitchen. Buzzing, but not overly loud. Reasonably space tables. Well put together cocktails, cheaply. Best chicken club in London. The porterhouse for two is a bit scary large. Good for groups.

WL0H0UIJYVkClJLrm47Lhw.text: This place is great.The staff are truly lovely.The food is fantastic.It's a fairly smart hotel restaurant, but very reasonably priced considering. Main courses start at £10, and probably go up to £20 or £25. They seem to do quite a few special offers. I saw a wine offer on their website, and before 7pm on certain days they serve some of the normal dishes at £7. E.g. steak.

2mkZxP0ARNp6gWflmhjMbA.text: Yummdiddlyscrumptious!!! Been here a few times now... the Porterhouse steak and mini sausages are our faves... Cool, laid-back atmosphere... with a lush vibe. Polite and helpful staff, and cracking cocktails. Will definitely go back... sooner rather than later!

dJMy7xqeiPkfO6kzVO0qTw.text: If you're looking for a meaty lunch then this is a decent spot. Steaks are good, nice atmosphere too. Spacious venue, would recommend.

Z2N_ZZmDDxsV9gv04ONhQA.text: Great food and well presented, plus polite and courteous staff. Nice design of hotel and restaurant. We will definitely be going back.

ZiU7cYTB69wtCge24KWHPw.text: I have eaten here for breakfast and evening meal, its fantastic. The staff are so friendly and the food is excellent and reasonably priced. My wife and I both had steak and it came on like a chopping board which we had never seen before, beautifully presented and tasted fantastic. It was our anniversay and was fantastic. The breakfast that I had the following day was just as good with plenty of choice on the menu and great coffee. The sta Will always go back when in London.

1Vl9SP56Xsac9Z9-15rPbg.text: I've visited the Hoxton twice and very much enjoyed both visits, the most recent being New Years Day evening.  In my opinion the surroundings are large & open but cosy & stylish, the atmosphere warm & friendly, the staff polite, attentive & friendly.  We ate here both times and can highly recommend the food especially the Shrimp Starter which was the best I've tasted.  We found the drinks a little pricey but maybe cause we're Northeners we struggle with Southern prices.  I haven't stayed at the hotel or sampled their nightclub - maybe next time as we will return on our next trip to London, I'd highly recomend the Hoxton to friends looking for an enjoyable evening in good surroundings, however I would warn them to ensure their wallets are strong enough to handle the expensive bar even by London standards which is the reason I don't award the Hoxton a 5 Star rating.

mmlWOqxuxJpfxUpKjQcDmQ.text: Food is good but cocktails are amazing!!! My most favorite is Mr Millers. Just amazing!! Bartenders always seems fun and friendly. But keep in mind its kinda busy specially Fridays and Saturdays, so its not easy to reach bar quickly :)

1duwzZgZepDKhNpFSAhOtw.text: My daughter and I went in for dinner on Sunday evening and they were not busy with many open tables. We asked for a table for two and we were offer a large community table for 8 people or a table in the lounge. We took the community table since my daughter did not want to sit in a lounge with people drinking and carring on. We felt uncomfortable from the beginning and not welcomed at all. There were many booths open with other parties of two and we could not understand why we were put at such a large table!! Service was very poor!! One server asked us for our drink order and I ordered a bottle of still water and he walked away never asking my daughter what she would like to drink. When another server returned with a bottle of still water my daughter then asked for a lemonade. The server said ok and asked what we wanted to order. We placed our order and he then asked my daughter again what she had ordered to drink. We did not feel as if we were a priority to him at all.Dinner arrived and it was very good!! If you are going for good food then this is the place. If you like dining and good service then this may not be the place for you. If you come with a 12 year old child this is definatly not the place for you!!!!While eating never did any of the twelve servers standing around follow up with us to see how our dinner was. We had another server ask if we were done and remove our plates.We decided not order dessert because we just wanted to get out of there.We decided to order room service and get dessert in our room. We are staying at the Hoxton for a week and will not return for any meals!! I operate a multi million dollar restuarant in San Francisco, California and planning on using this exprience as a learning tool and hope that anyone who walks in the doors of my operate feels welcome no matter where they come or what age they are!!!

_g_W2-7y3X2vVqnagS4Ndw.text: A bastion of glass and brass in Shoreditch. Simple, yet complete menu, heavy on the meat. Quality ingredients served correctly, with thought, and in ample quantity. Attentive service and open kitchen. Buzzing, but not overly loud. Reasonably space tables. Well put together cocktails, cheaply. Best chicken club in London. The porterhouse for two is a bit scary large. Good for groups.

B16DzcpkN2dp5TTCz0feIA.text: I can be a little naive sometimes. Don't judge me for it though. When the happy chaps at Casita recommended we head to The Hoxton Hotel to carry on the night, we were dubious. A hotel bar? I was thinking stiff barstaff, extortionate prices and stuffy guests. Nope. Well, drinks aren't the cheapest actually!Big and spacious, almost an extension of Great Eastern St itself, the lobby of the Hoxton is a place for late night revellers, hungry souls and those too stubborn to go home. Oh and those who just can't be doing with queueing and paying to get in somewhere else. One long-ish bar, a huge seated area for those who'd like to eat or rest their legs, and plenty of open space - that's what you're going to get here. They have a DJ playing in the corner; a nod to the party atmosphere, but it can feel a little transient. People coming and going, meeting friends and scamping off somewhere cooler.I liked it though. A good way to wind the night down or consider your next move.

AUxmD0knWtaitkLPt9xG-w.text: A great spot for an ace night out. I have been here for two separate private events - once as a guest at my partner's business school alum gathering and once as a host to my business school friends. Both times I have been impressed by the feeling of spaciousness in an otherwise jostling-for-space bar setting and the relaxed atmosphere allowing for some easy banter over a wide variety of drinks. Definitely a place that attracts the banker/consultant/lawyer sort. Plenty of sofas and many private rooms which can host work gatherings and private meals for groups. Have only had canapes here and they seem nice, will certainly go back sometime to try out a meal at this place...

z3htj9a1py00jWcd-b_-8Q.text: Stylish place with a decent atmosphere and some nice drinks, but it's so busy in here you'll struggle to find a place to sit!

UplgdztvI1-G_6umanZuKg.text: Okay - I really like this place, let me go ahead and get that out of the way.I've been a few times with different groups of people and this locale never ceases to provide entertainment. The Hoxton Grille is like 4 places all wrapped into one. You have the bar area which is packed with people trying to get their drinks and reminds me a lot of University. There's a nightclub dancefloor - - which more than once I have had to pull friends of mine off their stage because they were making fools of themselves (one with the English flag). A coffee bar area with patio (haven't been on patio since Septemeber) which is cool and relaxed. And then they have a lounge area off the bar - - with a entire wall that is a window facing into traffic. This is a cool spot from Thursday-Saturday. I really wouldn't mind going here any weekend of the year, it never ceases to put a smile on my face.

5IIblYmTc7-TJYho2PxjVw.text: My friends like this bar a lot. I'm not completely convinced, but I understand the appeal. Went back to this bar on Saturday evening after a few month long haitus. There was no line to get in, but it was packed. Packed is good. I like packed. But I also like drinks and not waiting too long to get drinks. Even with the multiple bars I found this aspect difficult.But once again, I see the appeal. The dance floor in the back will get hot, sweaty and generally pretty sexy. The crowd it attracts are some of the best in Shoreditch - which is something coming from me considering my overall distaste for Shoreditch and hipsters. And I always have some fun here when I go, just never enough to say that this bar is great.A-OK? Yup that's about right.

CRfvLJaGPgK5uUYTdmku2g.text: Well this is a turnaround for the books. I'm afraid I'm going to have to revoke my oh so flattering four star review of The Hoxton Grille and give it, instead, a measly two. "In the name of what?" I hear you ask. "It's appalling service" is my honest answer.I returned to The Hoxton Grille to take advantage of its Lucky 7 early bird menu. No, I'm not a pensioner but a £7 steak sandwich with chunky chips is just too good to forgo in the name of a fragile ego. Granted, the food was amazing, I had a couple of fruit martinis again, both good with the passionfruit being better than the watermellon but oh, what's this, another Shoreditch establishment with truly abysmal service.From forgotten drinks to missing cutlery, rogue ingredients to the sight of our gorgeous looking food waiting ten minutes to be delivered to us by waiters too busy talking about their 18th Amendment jeans, the service at The Hoxton Grille is nothing short of appalling. We had five waiters in all which I'm pretty sure is a cardinal catering sin and worst of all, having waited for half an hour for someone to give us the bill a member of staff approached our table and asked us to leave because they wanted to seat some other patrons. Shockingly bad service which is a true shame because the food is beautiful and I'm totally down with the early bird specials.

B6JJ7dZirSiPZajc0h-ttQ.text: Been here a couple of times and always ended up having a good night. A surprisingly grown up crowd considering the neighbourhood, and also surprisingly large on the inside, the Hoxton Grill is always full but never rammed. Plenty of people stand around but we always manage to get a couple of seats on a comfy sofa.  Bar staff and door staff are extremely friendly and attentive, but I am a girl so that helps.The crowd is quite mature even though ranging for the mid-twenties to late thirties range.  There are a few bespoke cocktails on the menu and otherwise bar drinks are fairly standard.  The have a cocktail call the Pole Dancer which is *amazing*, only glitch is that it's a pig to make and the bar staff, who are all absolutely lovely, take a deep sigh when I order this drink because it is so complicated and takes a while to make, but it is delicious and worth the wait, try it.Music wise the Hoxton Grill could raise its game a little.  It plays laid back chillout music which doesn't always necessarily match the vibe of the crowd. Perhaps the venue doesn't have a dancing licence, there is certainly no dancing area, although there are always a few punters (girls of course) having a little boogie in the corner when a slightly upbeat song comes on.I haven't tried the food so couldn't tell you what that's like. There seem to be a couple of private dining rooms in the back for hire if that floats your boat. Also for those who like to know these things the toilet soap is from the paraben free Cowshed range which gets my massive thumbs up (I'm anti-Molton Brown punter in general).Good stop over venue. I like.

8i2-1fDdegvTm7Z3dUcl5w.text: All I can say is go for a steak. Have never been disappointed. Nice service and great to have a martini before eating over by one of the fireplaces on a cold afternoon/evening. Although I would say avoid a Saturday night as it can get quite busy. Sundays are the day to go.

zBr2dBE-34fZ9YpZ6ni3BA.text: One of my favourites.  Service always excellent and never stuffy or inept.  Food is very reasonably priced, and tasty if unexceptional. No issues with the drinks.  Has a friendly, busy, sort of upmarket vibe.

3k6gmGIZy6JUhz64OS9EBg.text: Good food. Quick Service.  Thumbs up on the dessert!If you are a guest of the Hoxton Hotel and you order room service, they are fast too!  Not a drinker (anymore) so I can't vouch for their drinks/spirits.

BUZWLDP9zCUB4TN_ExwnHA.text: Overall I was really pleased with this place.  The staff was really friendly and the food was great and not too expensive.  A solid place to satisfy a red meat craving that won't cost you your paychecky.  And I like that you can get a carafe of wine for those nights you don't need a bottle to share, but want more than just a glass.-salmon pot: incredibly delish-crayfish cocktail: very tasty-steak sandwich: pretty good.  came with mustard on it which ruined it in my eyes.-8oz hangar steak: great quality for a hangar steak.  the bearnaise sauce was amazing with it.  perfect portion.

em03CdDrW0DMMv-Zxo-6NA.text: Adequate, $$ for sweet potato soup, cheeseburger/salad & risotto with fresh squeezed orange juice & red wine.  Ambiance ok, service adequate, not great.

lX4RbnmWhwgc7SQpAxIkjA.text: Beautifully styled, huge atmosphere and generous platters of food served, but the price was dreadfully expensive  leading me to believe this place is firmly aimed at the hipster demographic and all who bow to their magnificence. While staff were attentive, there was an aloof feel about the place which meant I couldn't fully warm to it or anything it offered. The food was all very tasty, but I'd expect it to be outstanding for the price.

9rnpDhZIeNxT46aGqfQXow.text: Expensiveish American-style bar in Hoxton. All poshish and pretending it's where the laties from SATC would be, which they might. The drinks aren't all that and the food's not either. It's OK, but I'm not a fan. Not sure why (loads of) others are.

f3VKUEwp-FaunOxFzdNByQ.text: Popular hotel lobby.  Bit of a bar, bit of food.  Service was good, sat down immediately.  Ordered three steaks - all rib eyes.  Steaks were ok.  Not much more to say.  Dont quite understand the hype maybe its cos the word Hoxton is in the name.  Would go there if Hawksmoor and Redhook were closed otherwise I would to one of those.  They have better food and drinks and are much more fun.

hUzwlLXLZOHDoyMbP3uwqg.text: We were guests at the Hoxton, so we gave their restaurant a whirl.Food was acceptable and average, service is painfully SLOW!  I would suggest the lobby lounge for casual drinks and snacks.Venture out in Shoreditch for an alternative.

tELovNIvpn1gYuWOlFMb2A.text: The Hoxton grill is really quite fantastic. I have nothing to complain about really. They are particularly good with meat. They've ruined me for pork chops anywhere else (seriously, that was the best piece of pork I've ever had). The menu is a little small though, I would prefer more sandwich choices and I wasn't particularly fond of the house wines. That's okay though, because they have a great selection of other ones.In short, perfect for a dinner out

Kxg9flIBIqsQWjrRIq5C6g.text: A typical hotel establishment - while modernist and streamlined, it doesn't shake that austere and inauthentic feel so pervasive in most mid-grade hotel lobbies.I dashed in here, mostly in search of warmth, one early evening when I'd tired of waiting outside for someone to finish up with work across the street.  I sat down at a sofa and was surrounded by business types tapping away on their laptops.  The service was professional and prompt - I was quickly noticed by the staff and handed a very corporate looking drinks menu.  Something that surprised me about the places was the inexpensiveness of the libations... there was a wine promotion going on, and a whole list of martinis could be had for under 6 quid.  I ordered a pear mojito, which was inevitably too sweet for my taste, but certainly seemed in keeping with the surroundings, so I wasn't exactly let down about this.Mostly, I felt appreciative of the fact that nobody bothered me about being a solitary customer... everyone seemed completely absorbed in their own thoughts, such that the crowd, and the cocktails, and the surroundings were all secondary...and I was left to wait alone in peace.

_6waj1i9WkPcOJr8o9KiYg.text: The Hoxton Grill takes up quite a large chunk of prime location in Great Eastern Street. It is lavish, a bit brassy and brash, but good fun for groups of people. Inside is cut into sections, if you want to sit with your mates and drink cocktails you get the front part of the establishment, and those who want to eat at the restaurant are set a little back.It was a Thursday night when I came, and the place was buzzing; lots of chatter, lots of laughter. I think there was music playing, but I'm not sure I heard it over the din! Because of this I would hesitate to recommend the Grille if you want to go on a quiet romantic date, but if you are looking to kick start your evenings entertainment, then this place is perfect.The menu was a bit too heavy on the 'grill' for my liking - I am not a big fan of steaks, cuts and beef. However if you do like this kind of food then this is a meat eaters paradise. I made do with a starter portion of smoked salmon, which tasted very fresh. We were also given a complimentary bread basket which gets an extra tick from me. This was washed down with a very smooth Pinot Grigio. I'm sure the rest of the wine list is top notch.The Hoxton Grille is a very different type of place from the majority of Hoxtons scruffy venues, but I can see that there is a definite market for this kind of venue.

ajcmNfoU8h29aDzmQ1EioA.text: The Hoxton Grille, set on the ground floor of the Hoxton Hotel, is a classy joint with sleek lines and a gorgeous clientele. It has an impressive and extensive food menu and cocktail and wine lists, with staff who know what they're doing. The decor is fab - walls are flanked with paintings, and some rather strange objects littered throughout the venue (I'll let you find out what they are for yourself!), the Hoxton Grille is a great option when you feel like going somewhere a little less Shoreditch and a little more..grown up.

m6AuNjL865G92BiYml11XA.text: Was here late night so this is just a review for drinks and music.Nice place to finish off a weeknight out.  Not too crazily crowded, ample space to sit back and relax while having some drinks and chatting or to stand around doing so.  You can also make your own dancing space over by the bar area where there's more of a mob.  There's private rooms if you want with karaoke, saw a few companies/groups enjoying this.  Pretty large spot open late.

lzHmU8xpOzGE2nNyx2W10A.text: I had the popcorn shrimps and the polenta with vegetables. Heaven! The atmosphere is so nice and the design is incredible, I totally recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Great food, wine and beer. Amazing vibe!

iifSCnRBWk19elZpyaQIJw.text: Never had a better meal, come here every time I'm in London. I have always thoroughly enjoyed all the meals we have had here, and the drinks are quite amazing too. Very creative chefs with some amazing talent cooking some of the best meals I've had in my life, no joke. This stereotype of British food being bad has been crushed by this place alone. On this trip I could tell they have gained quite a lot of popularity because it is always so busy, and rightly so. Make reservations and plan for a great evening. I would say attire would be business casual. Prices are so extremely fair for the absolute wonderful quality of food you get. I will always come here anytime while in London.Don't pass this place up, inside the Hoxton Hotel in Shoreditch, London.

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. The Hoxton Grill inside Hoxton Hotel in Shoreditch, London
Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom

WqsvZhDSnWoVk9LUzbiTQg.text: Hoxton Grill is located in the wonderful area of Shoreditch in The Hoxton Hotel. It is a very laid back but classy restaurant with pretty good food. I actually have been here a few times (for lunches and dinners) as I was staying at the hotel so I can definitely say I enjoyed it. The service was great and the food came to the table fast. I like the relaxed atmosphere of the restaurant and the bar area. It's just as ok to go there alone and read a book or with a big group and have a great night out. There is a nice buzz in the restaurant and in the hotel lobby bar. I recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. A collage of my lunch in Hoxton Grill

qUx4mHuyYW7ROWOgo63OUA.text: I've been to eat the Hoxton a few times. My favorite things are the shrimp burger and the quinoa salad with feta. The shrimp burger is a deep fried patty with lots of shrimp in it. I'm highly into it. Their cesar salad is also pretty delicious. Make a reservation because it can fill up with hipsters and other hip people.

NYOrNCYijXze3NLDsZpUbg.text: Very simple menu, but I had the flat iron chicken and it was totally delicious with nice crispy skin. The meal came with a rocket and parmesan salad, and it was filling enough on its own. The decor is pretty trendy and there's a nice atmosphere, it's a good place for a work lunch.

28AlOBrq8LTagw0u337Q3A.text: Service was terrible and food is even worse.I stayed at The Hoxton Hotel and really liked it but, I would recommend going elsewhere to eat. I arrived in London late night, on a holiday so this was unfortunately my last choice.I ordered the Pulled Pork w/Apple Slaw expecting maybe a pulled pork sandwich. I DID NOT anticipate pulled pork molded and wrapped in bacon. It was disgusting. The pulled pork itself was decent but, the bacon was just unnecessary and the presentation alone made it look like something you'd see on thisiswhyyourefat.com.Now, don't get me wrong. I love bacon. I think it's safe to say that everyone does but, one of my pet peeves is when restaurants used bacon to mask crappy food. Oh it sucks? Let's sprinkle it with bacon cause it's just soooo hipster and trendy. The Hoxton Grill missed hipster and trendy by a long shot. But, they hit gross and not appetizing right on the mark. I will give it one extra star only because I liked the apple slaw.Let's not forget that your meal is served with snooty managers and hostesses. Your food is not good enough to warrant bad customer service.

zJ1I1dq4xVzzMSzQysZ9Hg.text: Hoxton Grill is a part of the Hoxton Hotel which is where I was put up a few months back when I was in London for work. The first few words that comes to my mind when I think of the restaurant/ bar are : swanky, posh, well maintained, friendly and good looking waiters. The couches are really big and comfortable and seems like this place is quite popular amongst the London Yuppies as its never empty and always buzzing. I opted for a cheese burger (yeah safe but always a winner) which was absolutely delicious and HUGE, but guess what? I managed to demolish that big bad boy all by myself! The burger came along with fries and salad as usual.  I have to say something about the fries here because I am a very fussy fry eater but the chefs at Hoxton just nailed it - it was not too thin, neither too fat but just right and very crispy (melts in your mouth). The drinks were reasonably priced too, 4.50 for a Corona is not bad at all I say. The waiters were rather friendly and sweet, he even remembered me the next day when I went to collect my bags and addressed me with my name (I was really touched because my name is not the easiest in the world). Verdict : Definitely going back again when I am in Shoreditch!

ZwWJsJYN0_D0gn09kNDb1w.text: I've had several (very different experiences) here at the cozy Hoxton Grill...nestled inside the Hoxton Hotel. The first: Room service while staying at the hotel. Absolutely great. Black bean burger with sweet potato soup, side salad and a Diet Coke in glass bottle delivered expeditiously to my room within about 20 minutes by a friendly redhead. No crazy surcharges. Very nicely done, I really enjoyed my dinner. The burger fell apart a bit, but the overall taste was very good. The sweet potato soup I liked so much I ordered on a future visit. If you can get over the consistency of purreed veggie soups (baby food! ack!) then you are in for quite a treat with this one. The second: Wandered over one solo Sunday morning (I'm embracing them, they're numbered!) to enjoy a paper and some hot breakfast. Enjoyed a very decent Full English for £10. Great service with a smile and strong Americano rounded out this meal. Exceptional service from start to finish, even though I lingered a bit to finish my reading. The third: Ventured back to sit in the lobby, work for a few hours, enjoy lunch and coffee. The wheels fell off a bit here. Yes, the fireplace was beaming me to higher levels of existence, the same home-like vibe, cushy chair, an outlet and fast wifi in which to indulge...but I literally could NOT get anyone to wait on me. I would've actually preferred counter service at this point as I'd like to have a few coffees and then lunch but pestering two different guys every time (with hours in between it seemed) I needed something started to get troublesome. I'd ask for something, the one would assure me it was coming and then I'd watch him amble around the restaurant for 45 minutes before coming back and not realizing that he had forgotten me. I'm not sure what the issue is...and it is still a lovely place to hang out (especially with the live music on Sunday afternoons, swoon)...but service in the lobby is a bit hit or miss. So rounding all those together, still a solid 4 stars. We live in the area so we will be back for dinner or to lounge I am sure...just be forewarned the service can range from excellent to subpar. The wifi is strong and free though, and their menu quite enjoyable. Great place to hang on a Sunday afternoon. Live music and a latte.

JeOTOGwd2dVKmcTM-DlCLg.text: Cool place, but subpar food.Came here twice. Once for lunch when I was working in the area, and once for dinner.First time I had the beef short rib. Okay texture as it was fork tender, but it was just salty with no other prominent flavor. My friend's mac n cheese w/ bacon and jalapenos was pretty terrible too. The pastrami (salt beef maybe?) salad was a little strange. It was a salad with pieces of salt beef and gherkins. Second time I had the pork ribs. It was average in terms of utility bbq ribs. I think the location gives this place more credit than it deserves. The setting is nice, crowd is young, but the food feels like an Applebee's that doubled its prices. Who let Applebee's sneak into Shoreditch?

6tQIOsbtI5TVu4Fvb4Ujhw.text: Manager/owner came out to talk to us. Great conversation, good food, laid back environment and close to the Premier Inn

EfUpK6LskZ8WEDosvUfsDw.text: Great venue, poor service! I have been a regular to this venue over the last few years.It is a great venue, in a good location with a decent crowd.The only issue I have is that the service has always been average, and it only seems to be getting worse.Bar staff talk to you as though they are doing you a favour by serving you. Grumpy faces and unnecessary attitude. The grill/restaurant staff are a friendlier bunch but are not as attentive as they should be. Often huddling as a group to laugh and joke etc. (Even on a busy afternoon), not clearing tables, and not checking on tables.There seems to be several managers on the floor, again, more bothered on being social with colleagues, or 'checking out' the female clientele.Great place, poor service!

qtJrYXxFMHI0zYvO7iWtzQ.text: It's your typical swanky hotel bar lounge, great for pre-partying with friends for the night ahead.Plenty of sofas, loveseats and standing space for large parties.  Slightly pedestrian jazzy house plays in the background.  Roving waiters are happy to take your order.The talent is of the professional working sort, I'd say mid-twenties to high thirties.  Very civil, polished, but noticeably more clique-ish than the pub-cum-club crowd of Shoreditch.

oTca4tIuXkkYt7x-r228bw.text: This place is hopping with a bar area in the front with a TV playing the olympics (since we were there during the London Olympics) and a bustling restaurant in the back. Luckily the place was pretty loud because the 8 of us were contributing to it. Service isn't bad here except our one waiter seemed to be understaffed and a little disgruntled. We finally ordered after waiting awhile and I got the short ribs. I am a sucker for short ribs and I'm pretty convinced it's hard to not make it taste delicious.The piece of meat I got looked really savory and I couldn't wait to take a bite out of it. To my dismay, the meat was actually dry. It had enough sauce to keep the flavor, but it wasn't enough to save this great piece of cow part.

8mc9QY7DXeiMt67cmfQ0EA.text: I love this place.  I always stay at the Hoxton when I travel for business so it's convenient to grab a bite in the mornings before heading into the office.  I always get the avocado on sourdough, a cappuccino, and a smoothie.  The service is always top-notch and the food consistent every time.  It's a great hotel restaurant and a spot I always look forward to whenever traveling to London.

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom

8n9o1nf25ZSN_anyWNvS9w.text: We stayed overnight and decided to enjoy Brunch/Lunch the next day, taking advantage of the £13.50 for two courses deal.I very much enjoyed the starter of Bacon with black pudding Hash topped with a Poached egg.The main was Risotto with Mushroom and Spinach but it wasn't that special meanwhile my Partner had whole prawns with Fennel and Tomato.I can't say either of us were enthralled. I think I would have enjoyed a Lamb Burger more but in all the food was ok.The Waiter was friendly without being intrusive.The experience was slightly marred by seeing a Service Charge on the Bill  I would have been quick happy to tip the guy.In all, if I wasn't eating here on the deal we were on (2 courses £13.50) I would not have paid more.

FOqmxSqc3uHNLE1YzypKVA.text: Okay, I love drinking in hotel bars. For my birthday this year, I kind of want to do a crawl of just hotel bars. Pretentious ones, quiet ones....and one stop will definitely be at the Hoxton Grill.A goodie both during the quieter week days and the overflowing weekends, it's a place where the city workers melt with the ultra-trendy eastenders, creating a much less annoying version of both.Can only vouch for the wine and spirits (which were actually the same price I'd expect to pay in the area), but the food smelled amazing. Maybe I'll give it a go next time.

6m0HQKQY8K9TAdNf44qfMA.text: The food is great, had polenta with grilled vegetables which was fantastic.  The missing star is for the horrible acoustics and mediocre service

KhLzCYbIJ3wLFH3XK11Qbg.text: So the Hoxton is nice, its nice.... just "nice".... It could be AMAZING but currently its just "nice". I booked a huge event here, we had 14 people for a conference in their apartment which is a review for another time. We booked a table for 14 in the bar of the grill. I provided all the card details and everything when we booked so there would be a seamless interchange of everything with just a signature from one of the organising party. Sadly the bar staff were literally the slowest things ever, I had to chase one of them around who was avoiding eye contact for about 15 minutes to order some drinks. We then managed to get their attention suitably to make sure drinks could be ordered. However when I asked to round everything up they faffed about with the bill (even though it was all on account) so much that we were late for our table reservation. I enjoyed the drinks they were well made, but doesn't everywhere in London make a good cocktail nowadays? Also they don't sell any Ales what so ever at this bar, which is kinda crazy considering its the thing that everyone wants. So it has a good vibe and atmosphere, but I could probably spend my money more effectively around Hoxton/shoreditch and get a little better customer service.

uwHLPayEHqsBJmG-ogECvw.text: Great location to catch up with friends and have a drink. The Hoxton grill is a regular for me when in London.

7ETns4vLiXDvjFHwoj4ZnA.text: As a creature of habit, I noticed that I tend to find 1 place that I love and won't venture out to try new places. I decided that that wasn't going to happen while traveling in the UK. This place was recommended by the concierge where I was staying. There is no place like this that I've ever been to before. I loooved the multiple seating areas that provided space for lounge seating, bar seating, as well as indoor and outdoor seating. I had the Mach & Cheese (which I am always crazy about and have to have every time its on the menu as well as the Quinoa Burger. The Quinoa burger left much to be desired but the Mac and cheese blew my mind. I felt as though there wasn't much thought given to those diners who are making healthy choicesWhat raised my review from a lower score was the service. I find that it's difficult to find great service in the UK. My sever gave me personable attention and had an extensive and intimate knowledge of the menu. He also had a colorful personality that made me feel comfortable since I was dining alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. No idea how the top got cut off
Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom

mLkRbT7RpglBfyNPqbbltQ.text: We went on 26th December, limited Boxing Day menu, which was basically the brunch menu. Food was mediocre.  The burger, no temperature asked, came out well done. Flat iron chicken had incredibly salty skin. Local beer - shoreditch blonde (Belgian blonde style) we enjoyed. They were out of Camden pale ale. Chips were terrible - frozen and undercooked. My green salad was partly rotten and drowning in dressing. Our server disappeared mid dinner. We observed him apparently enjoying his dinner with a fellow employee in a corner while we were still eating OUR dinner. Very unprofessional as he didn't inform us of his break nor did he assign a different server to our table.Wouldn't recommend coming here unless you're desperately famished (i.e. Boxing Day when everything else is closed)

Rgz5AavHL1DbcOycRgMFGQ.text: Venue - 3 Service - 2 Food - 3 Value - 3 Overall - 2 We decided to have late brunch/lunch at Hoxton Grill on New Year's day. I have always wanted to try this restaurant as I walk past the trendy hotel frequently. The restaurant is set on the ground floor of open planned hotel, occupying half of the space at the back. There are 2 dining spaces, with the larger 'indoors' american diner area which is next to the open kitchen. There is a second, smaller dining space, which looks like a conservatory with natural light.The restaurant was fairly busy but had quite a few empty tables, which had not been cleaned. We were instantly told that it would be a 10 mins wait for the table, by a not very friendly front-of-house, and without a smile. We waited at the bar, and eventually after about 20 mins, a table was ready. Our waitress was helpful, but clearly overwhelmed as she was covering about 10 tables. Food took a while to arrive (Eggs benedict and eggs & avocado), and was slightly cold on serving. The poached eggs were runny and done well otherwise.Overall, the experience was underwhelming.

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Hoxton Grill
Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict

Og1C5ASgZHWg-l3MUBB89w.text: Ordered:1) Flat Iron Chicken, roast garlic, oregano (comes with fries)2) Side of broccoliThis was hands down one of my favorite meals in London. Then again, I'm also from America and it's possible my reaction is slightly heightened due to being homesick after staying here for 2 weeks :). Either way, I thoroughly enjoyed this meal. The chicken was ridiculously juicy (like seriously), with great flavor, and was balanced with the perfect amount of saltiness for me. I also love garlic, so the cloves of roasted garlic around the plate just added to the magic of the dish.The broccoli is actually broccolini and is what you'd expect it to be (steamed). I soaked it in the chicken juices/sauce and cleaned up the plate.Service was friendly and there's a really cool, chill vibe in the restaurant. Needless to say, I'd definitely visit this restaurant again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. The best chicken I've ever had.

lJl2vfqUX-siEMjJ4BLnCw.text: Previous evenings I've been, this has been a five star place.  It has a busy, buzzy atmosphere.  There is organized, informal, competent service, it feels like being back in Brooklyn, in a good way.  And the food has been great too.  Everything's good so no need for me to tell you about specific dishes.  But last visit, mid-afternoon, there were very few customers, and all that efficiency was gone.  We recognized our dishes cooked, on the counter, under the hot lights.  And they sat and sat and sat, with no-one to bring them the 10 yards to our table, us too English to fetch them ourselves.  When they finally arrived they were tepid and dry, I sent mine back.  I'd like to put that aside as a one off.   But they had a large pile of burgers under the same lights (presumably going to a private room) and they took a few every ten minutes or so.  We were there for an hour, and there were still some left under the lights at the end.  Even McDonalds limits how long the let burgers sit on those chutes.  Those would have been some nasty dry burgers by the end.  So yeah, overall, do go there, just not at 4pm midweek.

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. My son's regular order
Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Should we collect it ourselves?!
Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Burgers sitting for an hour under the hot lights

iZ9t9QqlC3BEtv0EzStOHQ.text: Another one of those London hangouts where the free wifi and half decent coffee has attracted the good, the bad, and the hipsters...Ok so finding a seat is basically a game of musical chairs but if you do decide to go after work, the wine is nice, it's open late and it's always got a buzz about it.Not for the shrinking violets but strut your stuff and who knows who you'll bump into for a conversation.Just be warned: Foxtons have an office opposite ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Soho Negroni... Classic

7tbymkKo24DSIViBP1X43A.text: Great staff and amazing food! The atmosphere i awesome. Music from the 70s så well. Can it get any better?

NUi9GAMebYardkuMFw8t7Q.text: First time having brunch at this place after a yoga class and I really liked it. First, I like the venue and the atmosphere of the restaurant and the hotel, and the plus is that there is a free wifi which seemed to worked really well to me. Then, the food, quantities are quite huge for a sensible price compared to other restaurant, which is already a good point, but it is also very tasty. I had the avocado and poached eggs toast, and had a bite at my friend's club sandwich and all was very tasty. Try the cheesecake too for dessert  the only thing I would say is that the service was maybe a bit slow and absent-minded but at least they don't rush you out which is really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Avocado toast

7yua4Yvg3VBZG5r5K_xmhg.text: When walking past this Hotel I had always liked the modern design interior so one day we went in for some tea in the afternoon. The ambience was relaxed and cozy.I went a second time because I had a feeling the bar would make some awesome cocktails. I wasn't disappointed. They prepare all the classics (I loved my whiskey sour) and have a few HOUSE TONICS (like the SOHO NEGRONI) too. I didn't find the latter all too yummy but the atmosphere made up for it.Unfortunately the service was useless. There were some waiters running around who never stopped at our table, although it wasn't crowded. Eventually I ordered our drinks at the bar and had a lovely chat with the charming baristas instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Whiskey Sour and Soho Negroni

xmRagNiUV_j4tQOFQtLuxw.text: Nice place to go for (expensive) drinks. Do nice food though not cheap.Surprisingly the rooms aren't that expensive compared to other hotels in the area.If you want to drink to impress, not a bad place to come, also stay open late.

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Outside

jG5sJEJ8YHPybiixK0aueQ.text: Thank you Hoxton Grill - and your friendly, expertise bartenders - for making my sister's last night in London a memorable, awesome experience.I had spied photos of the roaring fire and armchairs on Instagram, and had been to the Holborn version of this Hoxton Hotel's lobby bar/restaurant -- so I already had this place in mind for fellow Yelper Andrea V's third visit to London.On her last night, we dined at nearby Cay Tre, then walked over for a night cap (or two) and to hunker down from the January weather. We each had an expertly made espresso martini, and the bartender was kind enough to make me a chili infused concoction of his own preference that was not on the menu but thought I'd like based on my telling him what kind of stuff I like.I cannot stress enough how key it is to a cocktail-focused business to have a bartender like this. They like talking about different drinks and new mixers and alcohols, and *like talking to people* and then bringing that together for a personal experience. Anyway, I enjoyed the more loungey vibe to this place (compared to the more retro-designer-house feel of the Holborn location) with its books and overstuff chairs, sofas and fireplace.I still feel meh about the menu (though the pics are starting to convince me)

WjgI1mBykxsqXeozhRqhKA.text: I have to confess I love this place! the atmosphere, service, food, music, people ... everything at Hoxton Grill is great! I've been there many time and I was never disappointed by it. They have the best cheesecake ever! If you are there you have to try it :) they have great cocktails and good wine selection It gets very busy so if you want a table you better book it or be there early ;)great place for a meeting with friends and family

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Salmon
Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom

OzwxrCw1uChvdG99Yms6gg.text: I teeter between 3 and 4 stars. I thought the avocado toast was aite. It didn't strike me as something I couldn't whip up myself (but maybe that's just the nature of avocado toast). While the toast was served warm, it quickly turned cold after a few bites. The poached egg atop the avocado was wonderful, though. The yolk seeped into the toast, a glorious, delicious mess.My friend got the English breakfast, which looked fantastic. He seemed to enjoy it and I believe has had it before. Definitely a great place to brunch and convenient for those living in the Hoxton hotel. I just wouldn't go out of my way to come here. Service was solid, and the teas were good. They didn't use loose leaf for my green tea, which was a slight bummer (I'm obnoxious about tea). But my friend's earl grey seemed to be loose... they just put it in a bag to seep in the teapot. As is true of everything in London, prices are steep!

NXYRC9jhsdeiRY9p0eAAEg.text: I've heard a lot about this place and tried their cocktails but never got to sample the food.Visited on a very busy Sunday afternoon-ish with a couple friends for a quick bite. The restaurant was full but the hostess told us we could sit in the lounge.We soon sat down and had the menu in our hands. We all opted for a burger, one of us had the chicken burger and we got some onion rings on the side. You can have your burger with salad or chips. Us being carb-consuming monsters, we went for the chips.The food was outstanding. I've tried both the beef and chicken burger and they were both delicious. Cooked as we ordered them and with a full taste profile. I really liked the chicken burger, next time I'll be getting that for sure.It's affordable but its also easy to spend a lot of money on the food here. All in all, an excellent choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom

dDLhfkpH1nSJ1-Y2yEwkow.text: We were staying at the Hoxton Hotel and one morning we decided to have breakfast at the Hoxton Grill rather than the free bag Pret breakfast that they deliver to each room. We sat outside in the courtyard and had wonderful porridge (oxymoron?) and eggs florentine. The food was good and very reasonably priced for a hotel restaurant. The service was fast and friendly. As for those who are looking for the bar scene, the bar/lobby was very busy every night.

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Porridge
Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Florentine

3t-RbLATNo1hyD7Pi_Vd_A.text: I just loved this place. Service was super. A place you definately need to try even if it is only for a drink

photos.caption: Photo of Hoxton Grill - London, United Kingdom. The Decor is very cool

alFtyIemJi0PpNgXb0tBWQ.text: You would have guessed, that the Hoxton Grill is only known for its good food....but nope, the bartenders also really know their thing - Whiskey Sour par excellence! On a weekend its pretty(!) crowded, therefore the atmosphere is great and cosy at the same time with all those couches. Hoxton Grill - you will see me again soon!

jqZmiyD06Z9T3M2xKouYXw.text: So my friend suggested going to the Hoxton Grill to eat dinner and seeing how I really do not know much about eating out in London I obliged him. I was a bit late but when I reached the restaurant I found him sitting in the back. The venue is nice, dark but very vibrant and popular. I believe the night I was there the front half was packed with business people who just got off work. Anyway looking over the menu I ordered the pulled pork apple slaw sandwich while my friend ordered the half rack of St. Louis pork ribs. For an appetizer he really wanted the mini hot dogs. We both ordered beers while we waited for our meals. The food came out and it was exactly as the name describes. The meal was nothing exceptional...maybe because BBQ style food is just better in the US? I'm not sure but I was definitely now WOWed. If I was given the option to go again...I most likely wouldn't. But the environment is super chill and other patrons seemed to really enjoy it.

x5p9EyHnEdosOt4wveHEjA.text: I've been here for drinks a while back but recently stopped by for Sunday Brunch after a rough yoga class @ Blue Cow.  We curled up at one of the couches in the lounge which was perfect after a tough work out.I had the black bean burger and ordered a side of sweet potato wedge - now I wasn't expecting a side of chips with the burger but hey, I love me some spuds!  I had a little bit of food envy since my friends ordered the breakfast stuff but will definitely be back for that again.

UO4U59WsVZgrdUYQRetkCw.text: I love coming here for a drink after work or when I'm in the area as I love the feel of the place, it has the chilled out vibe of a private members club with the books and the layout! The drinks are amazing, the espresso martini is the perfect pick me up on a Friday evening, and on a sunny day it's nice to sit in the open conservatory style part in the middle. I've not eaten here but friends have spoken highly of it!
